summary: This is a sealed court order from the Southern District of New York authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a specific T-Mobile phone line. The order is part of an ongoing criminal investigation into potential violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 1591 (sex trafficking) involving an individual identified as 'FNU LNU' (First Name Unknown, Last Name Unknown) and others.

persons.name: Stewart D. Aaron
persons.context: Issued the sealed court order authorizing the use of a pen register and trap-and-trace device as part of the FBI's investigation.

events.title: Court authorizes pen register on target phone
events.description: A United States Magistrate Judge signed a sealed order authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a specific T-Mobile phone line for 60 days.

keyFacts: The FBI was conducting an ongoing criminal investigation into potential violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 1591 (sex trafficking).
The investigation targeted an individual identified as 'FNU LNU' (First Name Unknown, Last Name Unknown) and others known and unknown.
A sealed court order authorized surveillance of a specific T-Mobile phone line using a pen register/trap-and-trace device for 60 days.
The order prohibited the service provider (T-Mobile) from disclosing the existence of the surveillance or investigation.
The document is dated December 6, 2017, and was signed by Magistrate Judge Stewart D. Aaron.
